definition: to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to store up/to grow (e.g. a beard)/to entertain (ideas)
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to stay
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Afghan forces were poised to strike.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗的军队蓄势待发。

sentences.english: The financial crisis was horribly damaging. But slowly but surely we are building up a head of steam.
sentences.chinese: 虽然金融危机造成的损失巨大，但我们正在蓄势待发。

sentences.english: The mighty force is the readiness of those who love freedom.
sentences.chinese: 该强大力量就是那些热爱自由者的蓄势待发。

sentences.english: But 18-year-old Liu Haoran was ready to take on the challenge.
sentences.chinese: 不过，18岁的刘昊然蓄势待发，接受挑战。

sentences.english: Might a new generation of airships soon be ready for launch?
sentences.chinese: 也许新一代的空气垫船将蓄势待发。

sentences.english: There is the milder end of the spectrum, or hypomania, then there is the full-blown mania.
sentences.chinese: 通常是在较温和的轻躁之后，蓄势待发的躁狂袭来。

sentences.english: “The American economy is coiled like a spring and ready to go,” he chirped in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 2003年，“美国经济像弹簧一样蓄势待发。”

sentences.english: Quality healthcare aimed at prevention is a trend that is rapidly gaining momentum.
sentences.chinese: 以预防为主的医疗保健已经是一个趋势，正蓄势待发。

sentences.english: Aquatic-product prices are also gaining momentum.
sentences.chinese: 水产品价格也是蓄势待发。

definition: to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
hibernation/living in seclusion
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
ready at any moment
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
(of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
to preserve and nurture one's spirit (idiom); honing one's strength for the big push
to pull the bow without shooting (idiom from Mencius); ready and waiting for action/to go through the motions/to practice/a trial run
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
unstoppable/hard to hold back
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to sprint/to spurt/to dash/big effort
near at hand/imminent/within sight
to invade/(of a storm etc) to strike/to hit
